title: Isaac’s Life and God’s Blessing
summary: Genesis 26 focuses on Isaac’s life. During a famine, God tells him to stay in Gerar, where he receives blessings. Like Abraham, Isaac claims his wife Rebekah is his sister. He digs wells and experiences conflict, but God reaffirms His covenant with him.

faq.question: Why did Isaac say Rebekah was his sister?
faq.answer: He feared the men of Gerar would kill him to take her, just like Abraham had feared before.

faq.question: What promise did God make to Isaac?
faq.answer: God repeated the covenant promise made to Abraham: many descendants and the land of Canaan.
